Docs.summary: The namespace is the .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This types in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient> are deprecated and will be removed in a future version of the .NET Framework. For more information, see [Oracle and ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/oracle-and-adonet.md).
The .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle describes a collection of classes for accessing an Oracle data source in the managed space. Using the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataAdapter> class, you can fill a memory-resident <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, query it, and use it to update the data source.
For additional information about how to use this namespace, see the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader>, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommand>, and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleConnection> classes.
> [!NOTE] > For conceptual information about using this namespace when programming with the .NET Framework, see [Oracle and ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/oracle-and-adonet.md).
The .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle supports a number of Oracle data types, including the `BFILE`, `LOB`, and `REF CURSOR` data types. For information about using Oracle data types in parameters, see <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType>.
